tool.name: Corrector AR
tool.description: - corrects sequencing errors in short reads
tool.command:
corrector_ar_2.0.py ##Needs to re-use read.lst file created by KmerFreq to define input short read files
##Inputs ##Check if performing consecutive or consecutive and space processing --space_consecutive_settings_type=$space_consecutive_settings.space_consecutive_settings_type #if $space_consecutive_settings.space_consecutive_settings_type == "consecutive" --filelist=$space_consecutive_settings.filelist --freq_cz=$space_consecutive_settings.freq_cz --freq_cz_len=$space_consecutive_settings.freq_cz_len ##Consecutive params --kmer_size=$space_consecutive_settings.kmer_size --consec_low_freq_cutoff=$space_consecutive_settings.consec_low_freq_cutoff --ascii_shift_quality_value=$space_consecutive_settings.ascii_shift_quality_value ##Remove from galaxy interface ##--thread_num=$space_consecutive_settings.thread_num #else --filelist=$space_consecutive_settings.filelist --freq_cz=$space_consecutive_settings.freq_cz --freq_cz_len=$space_consecutive_settings.freq_cz_len --space_freq_cz=$space_consecutive_settings.space_freq_cz --space_freq_cz_len=$space_consecutive_settings.space_freq_cz_len ##Consecutive and space params --kmer_size=$space_consecutive_settings.kmer_size --consec_low_freq_cutoff=$space_consecutive_settings.consec_low_freq_cutoff --space_kmer=$space_consecutive_settings.space_kmer --space_seed=$space_consecutive_settings.space_seed --space_low_freq_cutoff=$space_consecutive_settings.space_low_freq_cutoff --ascii_shift_quality_value=$space_consecutive_settings.ascii_shift_quality_value ##Remove from galaxy interface ##--thread_num=$space_consecutive_settings.thread_num #end if
## Check if using default or full parameters --default_full_settings_type=$default_full_settings.settings_type #if $default_full_settings.settings_type == "full" --max_read_change=$default_full_settings.max_read_change --max_node_num=$default_full_settings.max_node_num --remove_suspicious_data=$default_full_settings.remove_suspicious_data --trim_suspicious_end_regions_Q=$default_full_settings.trim_suspicious_end_regions_Q --trim_error_bases_Q=$default_full_settings.trim_error_bases_Q --qual_threshold_error_bases=$default_full_settings.qual_threshold_error_bases --length_trim_low_qual_ends=$default_full_settings.length_trim_low_qual_ends --min_length_trimmed_read=$default_full_settings.min_length_trimmed_read --convert_reads_into_paired_end_file=$default_full_settings.convert_reads_into_paired_end_file --output_format=$default_full_settings.output_format --min_length_high_freq_region=$default_full_settings.min_length_high_freq_region #end if
##HTML output --html_file=$html_file --html_file_files_path=$html_file.files_path
##Outputs for forward and reverse files --corrected_forward=$corrected_forward --corrected_reverse=$corrected_reverse

param.label: Maximum number of bases that can be changed in a single read
param.help: When this number is reached, Correction will trim data rather than adjust it

param.name: max_node_num
param.label: Maximum number of bases allowed in a branch and bound tree
param.help: This parameter affects the maximum memory used by Correction

param.name: remove_suspicious_data
param.label: Remove low quality or suspicious data

param.name: trim_suspicious_end_regions_Q
param.label: Trim suspicious region at the end of reads according to Q_value?
param.option: No - trim low quality and suspicious data directly
Yes - trim Q_value to less than or equal 2 continues region

param.name: trim_error_bases_Q
param.label: Trim error bases with Q value until it is less than or equal to 2 instead of correcting it

param.name: qual_threshold_error_bases
param.label: Set quality threshold of error bases
param.help: Bases with a higher quality value will not be corrected when using the BBT method

param.name: length_trim_low_qual_ends
param.label: Number of bases to trim from low quality read ends. Defaults to Kmer size/2
param.help: Sequencing errors tend to accumulate at the ends of rea6ds. Trimming these regions provides more accurate results.

param.name: min_length_trimmed_read
param.label: Minimum length of trimmed reads
param.help: This parameter sets the minimum length of final reads in the output

param.name: convert_reads_into_paired_end_file
param.label: Convert read1 and read2 corrected files into paired-end files
param.help: Some low quality reads may be discarded in the corrected file. Set this parameter to No if you are only processing single-end read data

param.name: output_format
param.label: Output file format
param.help: If input read files are in fasta format and ouput in fastq format, program will output all quality char=40+Quality_shift.

tool.help:
**What it does**
Corrector is one of two programs which is used to correct sequencing errors based on the kmer frequency spectrum (KFS). Since it assumes that most low frequency kmers have been generated by sequencing errors, the key to its error correction functionality is to distinguish the rate of the low and high frequency kmers. The use of larger Kmer sizes provides better results but conversely is more computationally intensive. In order to produce a more accurate result, the trimmed length and deletion ratio is balanced with the accuracy level. A practical kmer size should be chosen based on the size of the genome.
Note that 30X data is preferred for calculation of the kmer frequency spectrum.
When kmer size is less than 17 bp, KmerFreq AR and Corrector AR should be used because the processing will be faster than using HA versions. Memory usage will also be less than 16GB (15mer, 1G; 16mer, 4G; 17mer, 16G) for KFS construction. Also, KmerFreq AR supports space-kmer in KFS construction and Corrector AR supports Duo-kmer (consecutive and space kmer) in the correction process.
When kmer sizes larger than 17bp are to be processed, the HA versions of KmerFreq and Corrector should be used since less memory is required for KFS construction.
-----
**Outputs**
Each lane will generate two pair.fq files containing pair-end reads and one single.fq file containing single-end reads. If Corrector HA has been configured not to process single-end reads, this file will not be present. Finally, one pair.single.stat file containing statistical information will be produced.
For each read file, there is one cor.stat file containing statistical information for each file.
For each reads list file, there is one QC.xls file, containing quality control information.
-----
**Memory usage**
Memory usage is related to the number of high frequency (greater than low frequency cutoff) kmer species. The peak value of memory usage can be estimated roughly by this formula: HighFreqKmerSpeciesNumber * 8 Byte.
-----
**Further information**
When calculating the KFS, 30X data is preferred.
Remember that the ASCII shift of quality default value (Quality_shift -Q) is 64. You should check the file and make sure this option is correctly set.
Low-frequency kmers regions will be interpreted as sequencing errors, and will be corrected or removed in the final result. However, the whole genome shotgun sequencing will generate random reads across the genome, and some regions will have very low coverage. These regions will be removed. You should consider what this effect may have on your data when interpreting the final assembly.
